report_title: Big Hat Group Weekly Security Update Report
report_description: The Weekly Security Update Report is provided by Big Hat Group with the goal of making it easier to find the information System Administrators and Security Professionals need to keep their systems secure. The CVE Weekly Report is provided as a beta resource.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36027 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by an Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36027, with a CVSS score of 7.1. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain remote code execution privileges by running a specially crafted application or convincing a local user to open a malicious file. Successful exploitation could lead to minor loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The severity is rated as Important, and Microsoft has provided a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build numbers 118.0.2088.102 and 119.0.2151.58. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attacker would need to combine this vulnerability with other vulnerabilities to perform an attack. No workaround or temporary fix is mentioned. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page.
section_1_data.symptoms: Unsafe default configurations for LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing exist on Active Directory domain controllers that let LDAP clients communicate with them without enforcing LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing. This can open Active Directory domain controllers to an elevation of privilege vulnerability.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-4863 Heap buffer overflow in WebP
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a heap buffer overflow vulnerability in WebP, identified as CVE-2023-4863. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is present in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code. Google has confirmed active exploitation of this vulnerability. Microsoft recommends updating to the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) to mitigate the risk. The latest versions of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) are 116.0.1938.81 and 117.0.2045.31, which address this vulnerability. Additionally, Microsoft Teams for Desktop, Microsoft Teams for Mac, Microsoft Skype, and WebP Image Extension are also affected and have received security updates. System administrators are advised to ensure the installation of the latest versions of these products to protect against exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-38545 Hackerone: CVE-2023-38545 SOCKS5 heap buffer overflow
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft has addressed the CVE-2023-38545 vulnerability, a SOCKS5 heap buffer overflow impacting Windows. The vulnerability is in the curl.exe software consumed by Windows, allowing remote code execution. To exploit it, the victim must manually execute the curl.exe utility, use a SOCKS5 proxy, have a rate limit option set to 65540 or lower, and request an attacker-controlled domain. Microsoft has released Windows security updates on November 14, 2023, including curl 8.4.0 to address this vulnerability. Customers are advised to install these updates to ensure they have the most up-to-date version of curl. Automatic update recipients do not need to take further action. Microsoft warns against removing or replacing curl.exe, recommending the deployment of a code integrity policy to restrict the execution of vulnerable versions. Workarounds involve using a WDAC policy to deny execution of the vulnerable executable. System administrators can deploy this policy using MDM solutions, Microsoft Configuration Manager, scripts, or group policies. The vulnerability affects various Windows versions, including Windows 10 and 11, and Windows Server 2019 and 2022. For further information, customers can refer to the NVD and curl.se websites.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-38039 Hackerone: CVE-2023-38039 HTTP headers eat all memory
CVE-2023-36719 Microsoft Speech Application Programming Interface (SAPI) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Speech Application Programming Interface (SAPI) is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36719. The vulnerability has a base score of 8.4 and a temporal score of 7.3, indicating a high impact. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain SYSTEM privileges by running a specially crafted application after logging onto the system. The attack vector is local, with low attack complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to elevate their privileges and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update immediately to protect their systems from potential attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36705 Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36705, has been reported with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, potentially leading to unauthorized control over the affected system. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: Unsafe default configurations for LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing exist on Active Directory domain controllers that let LDAP clients communicate with them without enforcing LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing. This can open Active Directory domain controllers to an elevation of privilege vulnerability.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the patch immediately to protect their systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36428 Microsoft Local Security Authority Subsystem Service Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36428, with a CVSS score of 5.5/4.8. The vulnerability allows the disclosure of initialized or uninitialized memory in the process heap. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. The impact is high on confidentiality but does not affect integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided official fixes in the form of security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. No specific workaround or mitigation other than applying the official fixes is mentioned.
section_1_data.products: Microsoft Local Security Authority Subsystem Service
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability in the Microsoft Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) can lead to unauthorized information disclosure.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update immediately to mitigate the risk of information disclosure.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36427 Windows Hyper-V Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Hyper-V is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36427, with a CVSS score of 7.0. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, but real-world exploitability is very low, requiring 12th+ generation hardware and uncontrollable page contents. Microsoft has provided security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2022, Windows 11, Windows 10, and Windows Server 2019, addressing the elevation of privilege issue. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attack complexity is high, and the attacker requires low privileges to exploit the vulnerability. No user interaction is needed, and the successful exploitation can lead to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft acknowledges the efforts of the security community in coordinated vulnerability disclosure and provides detailed exploitability assessment for this vulnerability.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the affected system.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released a security update to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update as soon as possible.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36425 Windows Distributed File System (DFS) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Distributed File System (DFS) is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36425, with a CVSS score of 8.0/7.0. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server's dfssvc.exe process, running as SYSTEM user, by exploiting a non-default DFS namespace out-of-bound write vulnerability that results in heap corruption. Successful exploitation requires the attacker or targeted user to have both domain user and delegate management permissions on the affected DFS namespace. The attack complexity is high, requiring a non-default and unlikely configuration by a domain admin. This vulnerability has a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, addressing this critical issue. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the security of their systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36424 Windows Common Log File System Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Common Log File System Driver is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36424, with a CVSS score of 7.8/6.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to elevate privileges from Medium to High Integrity Level without user interaction. This vulnerability impacts various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server 2008 to 2022. Microsoft has provided security updates, including Monthly Rollup and Security Only updates, with specific build numbers for each affected platform. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploitability assessment indicates that no exploit code is available, and an official fix is provided. The vulnerability's impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability is high, emphasizing the urgency of applying the security updates. For further details and update downloads, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.
section_1_data.products: Windows Common Log File System Driver
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker with local access and low privileges can exploit this vulnerability to elevate their privileges.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update immediately to protect their systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36423 Microsoft Remote Registry Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft has released a security update to address the CVE-2023-36423 Remote Code Execution vulnerability in the Remote Registry Service. The vulnerability has a base score of 8.8 and a temporal score of 7.7, indicating a high severity and potential for exploitation. It is remotely exploitable, requiring low attack complexity and no user interaction. An authenticated attacker on the domain could exploit an out of bounds write vulnerability within regsvc to execute arbitrary code on the server. The impacted products include various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, 11, and related server core installations. Microsoft has provided official fixes in the form of security updates for the affected products, with build numbers specified for each. System administrators are strongly advised to apply these security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36408 Windows Hyper-V Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Hyper-V is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36408, with a CVSS base score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker on a guest VM to send specially crafted file operation requests to the VM's hardware resources, potentially resulting in remote code execution on the host server and gaining SYSTEM privileges. The attack vector is local, with low attack complexity and low privileges required. No user interaction is needed, and the scope of the attack is unchanged. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2016, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022, addressing the elevation of privilege vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to elevate their privileges and run arbitrary code on the affected system.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released a security update to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update immediately.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36407 Windows Hyper-V Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Hyper-V is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36407, with a CVSS base score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, posing a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and privileges required, and no user interaction. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows 11 and Windows Server 2022, to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix. It's crucial for administrators to prioritize the installation of the provided security updates to protect the affected systems from potential exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to elevate their privileges and run arbitrary code on the affected system.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released a security update to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update as soon as possible.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36406 Windows Hyper-V Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Hyper-V is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36406, with a CVSS base score of 5.5 and a temporal score of 4.8. The vulnerability allows unintentional read access to kernel memory contents from a user mode process. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. The impact is limited to information disclosure with no loss of integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution in the form of security updates for affected Windows versions, including Windows Server 2022, Windows 11 versions 23H2, 22H2, and 21H2, with specific build numbers for each. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. No workaround or interim remediation is necessary as an official fix is available.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability can be exploited locally with low attack complexity. No user interaction is required for the exploit.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their systems to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36405 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2023-36405) has been identified with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, and successful exploitation requires the attacker to win a race condition. The attack complexity is high, and no user interaction is required for exploitation. The impact includes total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a security update for various affected Windows versions, including Windows Server 2016, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022, among others. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker with local access can exploit a vulnerability in the Windows Kernel to elevate their privileges.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability is not specified in the post. However, it is recommended to apply the latest security updates and patches provided by Microsoft.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36404 Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36404, affects various Windows versions including Windows 10, 11, and Windows Server. The vulnerability allows an attacker to disclose values of registry keys they do not have permissions to view, potentially leading to sensitive information exposure. The attack vector is local, requiring low privileges and no user interaction. Microsoft has provided a security update (e.g., build numbers 10.0.14393.6452, 10.0.25398.531, 10.0.22621.2715) to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix, indicating the availability of a complete vendor solution. The impact severity is rated as important, emphasizing the significance of applying the security update to protect the confidentiality of information resources managed by the affected Windows versions.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability in the Windows Kernel allows an attacker to disclose information. The attacker can exploit this vulnerability locally with low complexity and basic user privileges.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update immediately to mitigate the risk of information disclosure.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36403 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36403, has been reported with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, and successful exploitation requires the attacker to win a race condition. The attack complexity is high, and the attacker does not require any user interaction. The impact includes total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a security update addressing this vulnerability for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and multiple versions of Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For further details and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Update Guide page for CVE-2023-36403.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to elevate their privileges on the system, potentially gaining full control over the system.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released a security update to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update as soon as possible to protect their systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36402 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36402, with a CVSS score of 8.8/7.7. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely on the client by tricking an authenticated user into connecting to a malicious SQL server via OLEDB, resulting in the server receiving a malicious networking packet. This requires user interaction and has a low attack complexity. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability loss. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows Server and Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server 2012. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36401 Microsoft Remote Registry Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft has released a security update to address the CVE-2023-36401 Remote Code Execution vulnerability in the Remote Registry Service. The vulnerability has a CVSS base score of 7.2, indicating a high severity impact. It is remotely exploitable, requiring low attack complexity and no user interaction. Successful exploitation allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server. The vulnerability affects various Windows Server and Windows client versions. An authenticated attacker on the domain and a member of the performance log users group could exploit an integer overflow vulnerability within regsvc to execute arbitrary code. Microsoft has provided official fixes in the form of security updates for affected Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Update Catalog or the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36400 Windows HMAC Key Derivation Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows systems are affected by a Critical elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36400, with a CVSS score of 8.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges by running a specially crafted application after logging into the system. This could lead to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack complexity is low, and no user interaction is required. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploitability assessment indicates that a successful attack could be performed from a low privilege Hyper-V guest, allowing the attacker to execute code on the Hyper-V host execution environment. This underscores the critical nature of the vulnerability and the importance of prompt patching to prevent potential exploitation.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit the vulnerability in Windows HMAC Key Derivation to elevate their privileges.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their systems to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36399 Windows Storage Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Storage Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2023-36399) has been identified with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, impacting integrity and availability. It is characterized by a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. Successful exploitation could result in the deletion of data, leading to service unavailability. Microsoft has released security updates for affected products, including Windows 11 versions 23H2, 22H2, and 21H2, as well as Windows Server 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The availability of an official fix indicates that a complete vendor solution is available, making it essential for organizations to prioritize the deployment of these updates to secure their systems.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to elevate their privileges on the system, potentially gaining full control over the system.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update as soon as possible to protect their systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36398 Windows NTFS Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows NTFS Information Disclosure Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36398, affects various Windows versions including Windows 10, 11, and Server editions. The vulnerability allows an attacker to read the contents of Kernel memory from a user mode process, potentially leading to a scope change and privilege elevation. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for the affected Windows versions, including build numbers 10.0.22621.2715, 10.0.25398.531, 6.3.9600.21668, and others. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix, indicating the availability of complete vendor solutions. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability can be exploited locally with low attack complexity and does not require user interaction.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their systems to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36397 Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) is affected by a Critical Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36397. The vulnerability allows an attacker to achieve remote code execution by sending a specially crafted file over the network when the Windows message queuing service is running in a PGM Server environment. This could lead to total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and multiple editions of Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, enabling the Windows message queuing service only when necessary and monitoring TCP port 1801 for any unusual activity can help reduce the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36396 Windows Compressed Folder Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Compressed Folder in Windows 11 is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36396 with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a target system, potentially leading to total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector is local, requiring user interaction, and does not require any specific privileges. Microsoft has provided a security update (build number 10.0.22621.2715) for Windows 11 Version 23H2 and 22H2 for x64-based and ARM64-based systems to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. No workarounds or mitigations are mentioned, emphasizing the importance of applying the official fix. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely through the exploitation of a flaw in the handling of compressed files.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability is currently unpatched. Users are advised to monitor the Microsoft Security Response Center for updates regarding this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36394 Windows Search Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Search Service is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36394, with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, and successful exploitation does not require user interaction. The attack complexity is high, requiring the attacker to win a race condition. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability losses. Microsoft has provided a security update for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server editions, to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect the affected systems. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit the vulnerability in the Windows Search Service to elevate their privileges.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released a security update to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to apply the update as soon as possible.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36393 Windows User Interface Application Core Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A critical remote code execution vulnerability, CVE-2023-36393, has been identified in the Windows User Interface Application Core, impacting various Windows Server and Windows client versions. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code with high privileges, potentially leading to total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector is local, requiring user interaction, and the exploit code maturity is unproven. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for affected versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and multiple Windows 10 and 11 versions. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the official patches to mitigate the risk of exploitation. No workaround or temporary fix is available. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker could exploit the vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. If the current user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker could take control of the affected system.
section_1_data.fixes: The update fixes the vulnerability by correcting how the Windows User Interface Application Core handles objects in memory. Users are advised to apply the update immediately.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36047 Windows Authentication Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Server 2022, Windows 11, Windows 10, and Windows Server 2019 are affected by a Windows Authentication Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36047 with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, potentially leading to unauthorized access and control over the affected systems. The attack complexity is low, and no user interaction is required, making it easier for an attacker to exploit. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability, with specific build numbers released for each affected platform. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. It's crucial to prioritize the installation of these updates due to the potential severity of the privilege escalation vulnerability.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to elevate their privileges on the system, potentially gaining full control over the affected system.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix for this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their systems as soon as possible to protect against potential attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36046 Windows Authentication Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Authentication Denial of Service Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36046, has been reported with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability affects various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2022, Windows 11 versions 23H2, 22H2, and 21H2 for both x64-based and ARM64-based systems. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a denial of service, resulting in a total loss of availability, potentially making the system completely unavailable. The attack vector is local, with low attack complexity and privileges required, and does not involve user interaction. Microsoft has provided a security update with build numbers 10.0.25398.531, 10.0.22621.2715, and 10.0.22000.2600 for the affected Windows versions, offering an official fix to mitigate the vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to address this vulnerability and ensure the availability of the impacted components.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a Denial of Service attack through Windows Authentication.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their systems to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36036 Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36036, with a CVSS base score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges. It is caused by a flaw in the Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver. The attack complexity is low, and no user interaction is required. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates based on their Windows version and platform to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36033 Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows DWM Core Library is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36033, with a CVSS score of 7.8/7.0. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges without user interaction. It impacts various Windows versions including Windows 10, 11, and Server 2019, 2022. Microsoft has provided security updates with build numbers 10.0.25398.531, 10.0.22621.2715, 10.0.19045.3693, 10.0.19041.3693, 10.0.22000.2600, 10.0.20348.2113, and 10.0.17763.5122. The exploit code maturity is at the proof-of-concept stage, and an official fix is available. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For further details, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36028 Microsoft Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP) is affected by a critical remote code execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36028, with a CVSS score of 9.8. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to exploit a PEAP Server by sending specially crafted malicious PEAP packets over the network. This could lead to total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability, impacting various Windows versions and Windows Server editions. Microsoft has provided a security update (e.g., 5032197, 5032199) for affected systems, addressing the vulnerability and preventing remote code execution. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, to stop using PEAP, customers should ensure that PEAP Type is not configured as an allowed EAP type in their network policy. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide and the Microsoft Support Lifecycle.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36025 Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (CVE-2023-36025) has been identified with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass Windows Defender SmartScreen checks and associated prompts by exploiting a specially crafted Internet Shortcut (.URL) or hyperlink, requiring user interaction. The attack vector is network-based with low complexity and requires no privileges. Successful exploitation results in a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution in the form of security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and multiple Windows 10 and 11 versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36017 Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A critical remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2023-36017) has been identified in the Windows Scripting Engine, specifically impacting the JScript9 scripting engine. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user, posing a significant risk to confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector requires a user to access a malicious server, typically through an enticement in an email or chat message. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Windows Server editions, addressing this vulnerability. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. No temporary workarounds or mitigations have been provided, making the immediate application of the security updates crucial to prevent potential exploitation.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user views a specially crafted webpage using Internet Explorer. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the current user.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released a security update that addresses the vulnerability by modifying how the scripting engine handles objects in memory. Users are advised to apply the update immediately.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-24023 Mitre: CVE-2023-24023 Bluetooth Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A spoofing vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-24023, has been reported in the Bluetooth Special Interest Group (Bluetooth SIG) and assigned by MITRE. This vulnerability affects various Microsoft products including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2019/2022. The impact is rated as Important. The vulnerability could be exploited to spoof the identity of a Bluetooth device. Microsoft has provided security updates for the affected products to address this issue. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-5997 Use after free in Garbage Collection
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a use after free vulnerability in Garbage Collection, identified as CVE-2023-5997. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has addressed this vulnerability by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. The fix is provided through the release of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 119.0.2151.72 for the Stable channel and 118.0.2088.109 for the Extended Stable channel. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36423 Microsoft Remote Registry Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft has updated the CVSS scores for the Microsoft Remote Registry Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows a remote, authenticated attacker to exploit an out-of-bounds write vulnerability within regsvc to execute arbitrary code on the server. The attack vector is through the network, with low attack complexity and no user interaction required. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability loss. Microsoft has provided security updates for various affected products, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, Windows 10, 11, and others, addressing the remote code execution vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The privileges required for the vulnerability are low, meaning any authenticated attacker could trigger it without admin or other elevated privileges. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely through the Microsoft Remote Registry Service. This can be done over the network without any user interaction.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their systems with the latest security patch to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36026 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a Spoofing Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36026, with a base score of 4.3 and a temporal score of 3.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to craft a specially designed URL, which when clicked by a user, could lead to the compromise of the user's system. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could result in some loss of integrity, as the attacker can bypass the warning on the permissions message when visiting a potentially malicious website. The attack vector is through a network, with low attack complexity and no privileges required. Microsoft has provided an official fix by releasing security updates for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build numbers 119.0.2151.72 and 118.0.2088.109. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle.
section_1_data.symptoms: The system exhibits a spoofing vulnerability in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) that can be exploited by an attacker via the network.
section_1_data.fixes: The official fix for this vulnerability is available from Microsoft. Users are advised to update their Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36008 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36008. The vulnerability has a CVSS base score of 6.6 and a temporal score of 5.8, indicating a moderate severity. It is caused by a flaw that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code locally, requiring user interaction. The attacker does not need prior privileges to carry out the attack. Successful exploitation could lead to some loss of availability and limited ability to perform code execution. Microsoft has released security updates for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) versions 119.0.2151.72 and 118.0.2088.109, addressing this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the latest security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability is triggered when a user views a specially crafted webpage using Microsoft Edge. This allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
section_1_data.fixes: The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how Microsoft Edge handles objects in memory.

section_2_data.product_name: Microsoft Local Security Authority Subsystem Service
Windows Common Log File System Driver
